gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN.SHP is a line shapefile that shows the location of known structural features in Indiana. Attributes include the name of the feature (as listed on the paper source maps), a citation to which paper source source map contained the feature, as well as an indicatior of structural movement of each feature. The paper source maps used to construct these data have scales that range from 1:12,000 to 1:500,000 (only one fault trace) with the majority being taken from sources with a scale of 1:63,360 or larger.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN.SHP was created to show the most accurate information available on locations of structural features in Indiana, utilizable in a GIS system.

This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from this data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request and/or current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS 10.2 shapefile format, approximately 68 Kb

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Publication date

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Lines were clipped by STATLINE.SHP, a line shapefile of the state of Indiana taken from 1:100,000-scale information, which was created for the Gas Research Institute/Illinois Basin Consortium publication GRI-00/0068.
Locations and names of structural features were plotted and checked by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey for accuracy.
Whenever possible, digitized maps were calibrated to the nearest logical planimetric intersections.

The vertical positional accuracy of the published and nonpublished paper source maps is unknown. The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of this dataset. No quantitative tests were performed.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: A paper copy of each source map were placed on a digitizing board and calibrated to UTM coordinates in AutoDesk AutoCAD software. After all traces were digitized, two line coverages were created using ESRI ArcCAD software. Structural features were saved as an ESRI coverage named "INDSTRUC" and structural directional features were saved as "INSTRDIR". These coverages were then loaded into ESRI ArcView 3.2 and attributed with the accepted names of the structural features. The digitization of the structural features named "Sharpsville Fault" and "Fortville Fault" were performed by an IGS geologist using Surfer software and exported in DXF format. This DXF file was imported into ESRI ArcView and converted to a temporary coverage. Both datasets of structural features were then joined in ESRI ArcView using the GeoProcessing Wizard, and was then saved as "INSTRUC".

INDSTRUC and INSTRDIR were joined to a single coverage named "STRUCT" using ESRI ArcInfo. STRUCT was then reprojected to UTM Zone 16, NAD83 coordinate system, and then clipped to the boundary of Indiana, using the clip coverage named INCLP83. INCLP83 was compiled at at a scale of 1:24,000. Because STRUCT and INCLP83 boundaries did not coincide perfectly with one another, some lines along the state boundary were either slightly truncated or slightly extended to the new boundary. In every case, the modifications were minor. The resulting coverage was then saved as an ESRI line shapefile named "STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN.SHP" to follow the file naming conventions of the IGS.

The paper source map named "Map of Allen County, Indiana Showing the Topography and Geology of the Bedrock Surface" (Indiana Geological Survey Special Report 57, Plate 2) was scanned and saved as a TIFF file named "IGS_SR57.TIF." IGS_SR57.TIF was loaded into an ESRI ArcMap document and the "Georeferencing" tool used to georeference it to UTM Zone 16, NAD83 coordinate system. IGS personnel digitized two unnamed structural faults using IGS_SR57.TIF as a basemap, and the two features were then saved as a shapefile named "AC_FAULT_LINES.SHP."

The two unnamed structural fault line features from AC_FAULT_LINES.SHP were added to STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN.SHP using an ESRI ArcMap edit session. Additional attribute fields were then added to STRUCTURAL_FEATURES_IN.SHP. The field named "Source" was added to provide a citation linking the source map that was used to digitize each structural feature. The field named "Symbol" was added to contain a directional indicator of the geologic movement associated with each structural feature. The field named "Structure_" was added to distinguish between faults and anticlines. All faults and anticlines went through a QA/QC where the source maps were re-scanned, geo-referenced with RMS Error less than 75 meters, and all features were adjusted or re-digitized to match the source maps and provide the highest quality dataset.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
Fault traces and names for Crandall and Georgetown Faults, and unnamed faults in Martin County and Dubois County (near Bretzville).

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.
